intro: Blepharis cuanzensis var. parvispina, commonly known as the small-spined blepharis, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of tubular, two-lipped flowers that are typically pale blue to purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grassland or rocky habitats. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens in suitable climates.
